_exec_summary.SummaryText:
Objective:

The purpose of this 09/24/2020 RMP Resubmission is to address recent changes at ARLANXEO, USA LLC, Orange Site. The EPDM (Keltan) Manufacturing Unit was shut down on May 10, 2020. All the unit hydrocarbons and chemicals have been removed from the site and the storage tanks have been safed out. For additional safety, a fence has been erected around the perimeter of the EPDM manufacturing area and only authorized personnel are allowed with a key entry.



Other changes include a project to install a new Boiler #5 project which includes a 2,000 gallons Ammonia storage tank. The maximum operating level is 85% or 1,700 gallons. This change is documented in Section 3 of the Alternative Toxic Release scenario section. 



Facility:

The ARLANXEO, USA LLC, Orange site is located in the industrial chemical road, Farm Road 1006 of Orange, Texas. The facility had four operating units, Cobalt Butadiene Rubber (CoBR), Lithium Butadiene Rubber (LiBR), EPR (Keltan) and Therban Rubber manufacturing units, until closure of the EPDM (Keltan) manufacturing unit on May 10, 2020. Therefore, the site now has three manufacturing units supported by a common Utilities department.

The site now produces three basic types of polymerized synthetic rubber with variations of each type.  These include two different types of polybutadiene rubber and hydrogenated nitrile butadiene rubber. The synthetic rubber produced from the site is used by customers to fabricate consumer products such as tires, hoses, timing belts and several automotive parts. The Utilities area of the plant supplies water, steam, electricity, compressed air, cooling water, potable water, process water and refrigeration for the polybutadiene production units. The Orange site Utiltiies department also supplies steam to a neighbor Chevron Chemical plant.



Hydrocarbons are used as monomers and solvents in the units.  ARLANXEO, USA LLC, Orange Plant inventories all the hydrocarbons used in the plant. There are now two

hydrocarbons solvents and two chemicals that are used in quantities above the threshold quantities as defined in EPA 40 CFR Part 68 Risk Management Planning regulation. The hydrocarbons solvents are 1,3-butadiene and 1-butene.  The other two chemicals are chlorine and anhydrous ammonia, which are primarily used in the Utilities department. 



The ARLANXEO, USA LLC, Orange, Texas site supports many outreach programs for the community including, the United Way, a Community Relations Committee, and an employee sponsored diversity program (MOSAIC). The facility maintains a ISO 14001 standard.



Recent Changes and Improvements: 

Most recent changes and improvements includes, shut down of the EPDM (Keltan) manufacturing unit, process enhancement at the LiBR rubber manufacturing unit and Boiler #5 installation project. Installation of the Boiler #5 project is necessary due to termination of the contract between ARLANXEO and the COGEN plant which supplied steam and electricity to the Orange site and a neighbor Chevron Chemical plant.  



Process Safety and Risk Management:  

The ARLANXEO, USA LLC, Orange Plant is a PSM covered site. It is in compliance with the OSHA PSM Regulation 29 CFR 1910.119 and EPA 40 CFR Part 68 Risk Management Planning regulations.  All the manufacturing units comply with the fourteen PSM elements, and are considered to be Program Level III process under Risk Management Planning. 



The site PSM programs include:  

Employee Participation 

Process Safety Information

Process Hazard Analyses

Operating Procedures

Employee Training

Contractor Safety

Pre-Start Up Safety Review

Mechanical Integrity

Safe work Practices

Management of Change

Incident Investigation

Emergency Planning and Response

Compliance Audits

Trade Secrets



Accidental Release Prevention and Emergency Response Policies:  

Release Prevention:

Handling of hazardous materials undergoes a rigorous process hazard analysis review.  The site maitains a Management of Change

(MOC) program across the plant with updated procedures, incident and near hit reporting, preventive and corrective actions, and tracking of action items to closure. The site also maintains a mechanical integrity program for equipment, piping and vessel inspections, testing and repairs.  



Maintenance and improvement of Health, Safety and Environmental systems are ongoing at this facility and training takes place throughout the year.  Safety and environmental recommendations from employees, whether made during formal sessions like Process Hazard Analyses (PHA) or upon observation of a potential hazard, are investigated with corrective actions developed, implemented and tracked to completion in order to prevent future occurrence.



Significant safety improvements occurring over the last five years include a Health, Safety and Environmental Management System, upgrades in fire protection deluge systems, updated emergency response drills and training, implementation of PHA action items, and implementation of facility siting and building improvement projects.  All non-essential personnel are located away from potential areas for overpressure scenarios or explosion hazards.



Leak Detection Systems:

The site maintains a third party on-site Leak Detection and Repairs (LDAR) program. Detected leaks are reported on routine basis and necessary repairs are conducted to avoid major release incidents. There are hydrocarbons detectors located throughout the plant and are inspected and tested at least once a year. In addition, emergency shut-off valves and excess flow check valves are installed in discharge lines of major vessels throughout the plant, and are periodically inspected and tested to avoid catastrophic releases. 



5 Year Accident History: 

ARLANXEO, USA LLC, Orange site maintains exceptional safety, health and environmental record. All incidents and releases are documented and reported in an electronic data system. Every incident is investigated with corrective

actions developed, implemented and tracked to completion to prevent future occurrence. Besides minor releases of material inside the plant which have not resulted in personnel exposures or illnesses, there have not been any incidents or releases resulting in off-site consequences at the ARLANXEO, USA LLC,Orange site in the last five years. As a consequence, there is no report documented in Section 6, Five Year Accident History of the RMP report.



Emergency Response Program: 

The ARLANXEO, USA LLC, Orange site maintains a detailed emergency response plan. A trained emergency brigade and a hazardous material response team are maintained on site.  Disaster drills are conducted on site at least once a year and the site participates in local area emergency response drills.  In addition, the ARLANXEO, USA LLC, Orange Plant participates in the Orange County Local Emergency Planning Committee (LEPC) and Regional Mutual Aid Committees. The response time for the local emergency management team is less than fifteen minutes to the plant. There are warning lights and signs on the roads leading to the plant to warn motorists in the event of a plant emergency.  The signs are activated by the local Police Department and maintained by the LEPC.
